US2pFzUHfBOc7RssL2lQkQ.text: I grew up with polenta, I love polenta, I want to eat polenta all the time.I wandered past the place within a few days of opening in December. I always look at new restaurant's menus and was lured in by the VEGAN section! It looked great, but I had just eaten. So for a dessert, we went in for an espresso and a (Ms Cupcake) lemon cornmeal cookie. It was cute, good ambiance and we had a nice chat with the owner. I tried for weeks to get someone to go with me to try it out.Fast forward to March. I had the mixed mushroom polenta. It was probably 1 1/2 cups of polenta, topped with herby mushrooms. It was nice. Nice. Just nice. And I know it's Soho, but £8 for a not-huge portion of polenta (the cheapest thing in the world) that I genuinely ate in 5 minutes (while talking), was a bit offensive.However, the sweet breakfast polenta sounds pretty tasty and if I'm ever in the area and needing breakfast, I would definitely go. And If I need a vegan treat and coffee, I will definitely go.But for dinner, I may skip.

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Menu as of Dec 2013
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Polenta-almond-lemon cookie with an espresso

DrjTXLNxvH0a9E4NmW36lw.text: Excellent pasta, excellent polenta, and a staff that really cares about the quality of the food and their service.  We had an excellent vegan meal and they made sure our daughter had something she liked as well.  It was nice to have so many Italian's helping us:)

7I-reuRLHjOlquLeWIa5VQ.text: Popped in while passing by as it had a recent mention in Time Out for being of a new breed of restaurants specializing in one dish & I'm a fan of polenta.  I was actually a little bummed that they had a wide menu of varied offerings rather than just standing by the polenta as I expected.  There were pastas on the menu & the waiters were eagerly pushing me to pick items out of the display case by the street side for an a la carte tapas style lunch.  Right or wrong, I came in b/c they were called Polenteria & that was what I wanted to try to see how good theirs was.  There were several friendly Italian guys on staff all across the floor & I appreciated their enthusiasm for the food.I ordered the 'Sausages from begrime' upon the waiter's recommendation.  It was tasty, however considering the simplicity of the dish (a ladle of stewed sausages & beans in a tomato sauce over creamy polenta) the £12 price seemed pretty outrageous.I probably won't return but I would happily look forward to the next iteration of this idea, perhaps customers could approach a food line, pick creamy or grilled polenta & select from a range of toppings to put on top, all while charging a more realistic/fair £4-6.  A simple way to enjoy jazzed up polenta w/o all the fuss?

YTa9jzTkYlkty8FDjxXhkg.text: I was really excited when this place opened as I love polenta! It's a basic dish but made well it tastes amazing... However what I had at La Polenteria was anything but - the food tasted like it had been microwaved the polenta wasn't smooth but more spongey.. The meat and sauce were piping hot but not in a freshly made way - more in a "left it in the microwave for too long" kinda way. I haven't been back since.

uR0rBq8kYc0-hyahcYG2ug.text: Wow that was an AMAZING Bloody Orange Polenta cake !!! And the place is so nice.Very small but very well made.The service was really nice too :)

Y81fUTxL4mJBAK0yOpuosA.text: Really refreshing to find so much to eat on a menu! Rediscovered my like for polenta here. Particularly keen on the starter with fried egg and cheese. Atmosphere could do with some improvement however - wasn't somewhere you could settle into or hang around.

n58c7T_Eac5Q28hrYFJa3w.text: I had this place bookmarked for a little while but I couldn't find anyone to go with. What is it about the word polenta that makes people so reluctant?!But I know that polenta done right is an absolute delight. And I was indeed delighted!Its got a low key interior, a nice woody combination of minimal and hipster. The menu is short and simple, and on the recommendations of other yelp reviews I ordered the polenta with aubergine.We did have the little bite things to start with, but they really were so small and pointless. Not even a mouthful! Save yourself for the main event and dessert I reckon.And the main event indeed... Such a textural delight! Creamy. Grainy. Fluffy. And the the aubergine was spot on too- I was so impressed. Clean flavours, fresh... I was quiet for most of my plate which was a real occurrence! My companion had something meaty and was equally impressed. I had dessert and went for the chocolate brownie (and that lasted 0.7 seconds- squishey and intense).The service was efficient and friendly, we had some jokes with our server, and the prices were reasonable. Ideal date spot for friends with dietary requirements. I will definitely be going back again!

JtBIX5ORAuBKOtutGLuLwg.text: I really enjoyed eating here, a good friend of mine and I were planning on trying Mildred's but the wait times were too long so she suggested this restaurant! We are both Italian and really enjoyed the food here! I was very impressed at the creativity of the chef, using polenta for appetizers main courses and the dessert, which was surprisingly good! I shall return!! Busy place but no waiting, friendly service and tasty, well priced, healthy food! I recommend it!!!

Q7D6pUQ5ESp5HilU9qT5rA.text: Visiting from the US, we were lucky to have family as tour guides. With 4 people being gluten free, this was a home run! It was unbelievably delicious and creative. When we come back to London, we will be back to this location for an excellent experience and delicious meal.

EAbBi2tP8mpFgORkxTKgRQ.text: As a vegan, I love the dedicated and delicious choices.  The service is friendly and the food fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Spinach and polenta gnocchi.  Vegan and gluten free Yum

Q4zdkBKNj6kQjWo4PCYaWw.text: Loved it! Yummy, interesting food and good wine. A unique dining experience. All gluten free which is a big bonus. I will be going back to try more.

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Polenta for 2

AXp_9XL4060JUh1tusTWpA.text: I've walked past this restaurant so many times and despite seeing the 'gluten free kitchen' signs, i'd never managed to go inside. I finally made a reservation for dinner and wow I was definitely not disappointed! I had the gnocchi with truffle cheese and wow it was delicious! Others I was dining with had the pork (which was very well received) and the salmon gnocchi which was a different gnocchi than the truffle cheese one. All was absolutely delicious, and I was well impressed. The desserts certainly shined also - chocolate cheesecake ... delicious! The only complaint I have was the bread which was hard and crumbley... it was pretty hard to eat but the waiter apologised profusely, omitted it from the bill and said it was supposed to be a soft focaccia. I'm not sure what had gone wrong with it, but nevertheless, not enough to deter me... i'll be back to try the past and give the bread another go! Delicious!

e4HUWzn6PsjfTftcPk_dug.text: I don't know why but I expected better from La Polentaria. It's a simple concept and should be easy to pull off but there was something just plain bland and boring about it. The service was fine and the waiter was very friendly, keeping us mildly entertained with little jokes. The waitress who brought us our drinks thought it a little strange when I wanted to pour some of the wine myself, but I get a little uncomfortable when they pour it for a group of people.We didn't try any of the starters as we were all happy to go straight for a main. Between us we tried, I think, six different items. I had the Wild Boar which was ok but the signature item, the polenta, was a stodgy mess at the bottom of the plate. My wife had the pasta and ragu which was bland even with a liberal coating of salt. She couldn't finish it so I had a little of it and I can honestly say I've had better at Bella Italia. The others at my table had things like the Sausages and beans, steak and chicken. I tried a little of my friends chicken dish and it was overpowered by the smoked cheese in the centre.While we were there I bumped into an old friend who was with three friends. She sent me a message later on telling me that they thought the food was "gross". Not exactly a ringing endorsement!The only pluses that I found here was the waiter was entertaining and the house wines were very tasty.I won't be returning but don't let me put you off. Give it a go and see if you have a better time of it!

skpFf2VDApk-kFkxJIuS7Q.text: Great meal! This is the first time my wife has been able to order from the menu without parsing for what was gluten-free...it's all gluten-free.

f1VIXxQwRi_0vgXkH4n1FA.text: All the way from the Michigan to find this little place!!  What a great find. The food was great and the service was amazing.  Thanks Francesco for the great meal!!

onz-7L7L_bQlz2YxdsQYdg.text: Having read numerous reviews of this new restaurant I was keen to give it a go!The menu is pretty simple... POLENTA! You can have it with a variety of toppings (meat, fish and veggies). You can start the meal with mini baked polenta with toppings (like blinis!). These were reasonably tasty, but nothing too exciting.The main event was... good but didn't wow me. The polenta is cooked well and definitely the best I ever had but the toppings were a little bland. Another issue was that the menu didn't offer any side dishes. It would have been nice to get some vegetables to go along with the meal.The puddings had yet more polenta in! A decent polenta, almond and lemon cake.I enjoyed my visit here, but I kinda feel once you've done it once why do it again? The dishes won't change - as it's name states it's all about polenta!

KgiT2S_b6lR0sIdUBlpwYA.text: The service here is very caring: they really look after you, and come up with honest suggestions re. orders. The food also happens to be very tasty and fresh. Must try.

_84lOl_FCIt8DN6TpvdS0g.text: I suffer from celiac disease, this was paradise for me. Had pasta bolognese, gnocchi and tiramisu. Very friendly staff. Wish I had one in the states!

4gzO309V7NTDbetZ4opigA.text: I just returned from London from a 2 week vacation and had to stick to a gluten-free / milk-free diet, and finding places that cater to those dietary restrictions is difficult. Most restaurants in London did an okay job at having gluten-free / milk-free options but this place by far served one of the most tasty meals during my two weeks. I had the Pollo alla Romana and the Rocket with fennel, green beans, oranges and olives, and topped it off with a brownie. They also had a lot of vegan options. The owners very friendly and welcoming and the atmosphere was bright and comfortable. Having been spoiled by New York City and San Francisco cuisine, this measured right up to what you would find in either of those cities. Again, not so of a lot of places I ate in London, living up to the American stereotype that British food is often not very good and completely over-priced. Also, Time Out has them listed under Chinatown area but it's really much closer to Covent Garden and Soho, one block from Shaftesbury Avenue.

f4xPaIDjGckP7lGcfhqbtQ.text: Cute interior, the employees were extremely nice and attentive. It's unique how you write your order down instead of them taking it. We ordered the homemade bread selection for the starter, and the pink ravioli. All of it was delicious, we would definitely eat here again.The only thing is that the seating is awfully close together if you sit along the wall on the bench, so it was hard to squeeze in. Besides that everything was wonderful! Thanks for having us :)

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom

MD6vJjTgc4FUWITghK3H4Q.text: Had an amazing dinner here! I came in around 6:30pm on a Sunday. I was seated and promptly given a menu. The service was amazing! Very attentive and friendly. It's a small dining room, very quaint and intimate. I ordered the salad and the bolognese pasta. Both were to die for. Those who are GF know how hard (okay, basically impossible) it is to normally eat an Italian restaurant. Was so happy I stumbled upon this gem in Soho!

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Bolognese pasta. Delicious!
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Greens salad + bolognese pasta. Amazing!

L5mnzC58aaOb4didun3JTA.text: Both my SO and I are gluten free and always have a rough time with eating while travelling. Leggero came up in our search for London, and we decided to check it out for dinnerReservations are highly recommended - we got lucky and we're able to snag a spot in this small but trendy and cute restaurant, but many others who came in after is had to be turned away as they were booked for hours. The pasta and bread were AMAZING. It is difficult to find GF foods without any corn added to them, so this was a real gem. So much food that was prepared by the great staff (everyone was so friendly and genuinely wanted to know how your meal was). The desserts were delicious too- the tiramisu was one of the best we have ever hadIf you are GF and have similar issues with eating out then GO HERE! and even if you aren't gf GO HERE!! You won't even know the difference.

gvVWbHz0dQrb562NVudelA.text: Could not tell that the pasta was gluten free at all.  Service was friendly.  Pink ravioli with Gorgonzola was so amazing!!  Great al dente bite and super tasty.   Tiramisu dessert was to die for

-aOvqlFh9GEC8aLTdIXOtA.text: During our holidays in London we visited Leggero once. We made a reservation but somehow we mixed up time zones and came too early. This was not a problem, one table was still free. The bad thing was that it was one at the entrance so it was cold, dark and draughty all the time. Plus there was always somebody standing beside us asking for a free table. I really hope that these tables are not for normal reservations. The food we had was good, small portions and high priced. We knew this in advance and ordered 2 courses. Our favourites where the lamb meatballs with grilled butternut squash and, much to my surprise, the pink ravioli stuffed with gorgonzola cheese and beetroot, topped with pistachio and rocket pesto. After an hour we felt too uncomfortable to stay any longer so we left with some good food in our bellies.

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Glutenfree beer and Gin Tonic
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Baby Octopus
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Lamb meatballs

xtgjQt-sPjeSSy9iWj41Eg.text: We were lucky enough to get a table without a reservation and how fortunate that was.  If you must eat gluten free then this place doesn't leave you feeling cheated.  If you don't need gluten free you wouldn't think you were eating it. It's just that good.For appetizers we had focaccia with Parma ham and the butternut squash flan with a parmesan cheese sauce.  They were both repeats, but the flan won hands down.  We have never had flan as an appetizer and don't even like flan, but our server spoke so highly of it that we had to try it. Delicious! For dinner we had the Gorgonzola beetroot ravioli and tagliatelle with a lamb sauce.  Keep in mind all the pasta is homemade and it tastes like it.  What a treat.We had the tiramisu and cheese cake for dessert and I wish I could recommend the tiramisu, but can't. It really lacked flavor and actually seemed a little watery.  The cheese cake was very good and not sugary sweet.  We would repeat that one.The restaurant is pleasant with soft lighting and excellent service.Would definitely recommend it and return to it!

eTPBaSfK5hAEFdx_HXkuHw.text: Wow the food here was abysmal - I can't believe a restaurant called la polenteria does such bad polenta - I mean it felt like I was chewing on plastic - not one person in the group of four that came in today enjoyed it. We all felt that this restaurant should be paying its customers for the god awful polenta served.On top of the terrible food and pretty tame environment - it's gluten free ?! Make what you will of that.Finally when it came to settling the bill which we split amongst four - we had to separate service charge - so dividing it up five ways - so weird. Food is really gross - do yourself a favour and AVOID.

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom

ATH8cWoHVfF1CRNBgdoJUA.text: Have been wanting to try this place when in London. Had the duck ravioli and it was absolutely delicious however the portion was on the smaller side...would def go back though! The service was great and so was the food it was  just the portions especially since i only eat once during my 24 hrs stay i need something more consistent...

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom

QOrCREgXfbq9ai_ErsrDng.text: This place is simply amazing. Delicious gnudi and courgette burger. It's not too big, not too small. The menu is short enough so you are sure every dish is made with attention to details. Everything tastes so good, staff is very nice and it's not a loud place. A must try!!

TmRNac8IKWKW7pedlh6kQw.text: What a great gluten free Italian restaurant! Not only is every item gluten free on their menu, but they list all other common allergies underneath the dishes as well. So fish, nut, dairy, and sulphite allergies have more than just one or two choices on the dinner menu as well. I got the creamy polenta with pork belly and my boyfriend ordered the duck ravioli and a side of red pesto with polenta. We also had a chocolate avocado (yes your eyes don't deceive you, but all we tasted was creamy chocolate) mousse and their orange almond cake. If you are want to get dinner after 7 pm, I would recommend a reservation. We were there at 5:30 pm - because we had a show at 7:30 - and the crowd came in at 7 pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate mousse with dried fruits and powdered sugar!
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Almond and orange cake - gluten and dairy free and soooo good
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Duck ravioli and a side of red pesto with polenta. These were an interesting combo of sweet and savory!

FKi0jZP1C1x67i5yH0jI9g.text: Coeliacs and vegetarians/vegans alike, rejoice! La Polentaria has it all. Extensive wine list, accommodating and helpful staff, a creative menu, and a really authentic Italian vibe.  Never in my life have I seen the humble polenta dressed up so well. Try the gnocchi - you won't regret it! I was overwhelmed with the presentation of the dishes, so much so that I ordered a starter and two mains. The bruschetta was lovely and flavourful, the gnocchi was divine, and the mushroom polenta pie was almost too beautiful to eat.    Attentive staff checked that we were happy with our meals and explained how they prepare polenta, and how their process, the traditional one, differed from the instant polenta on offer in supermarkets. The combination of tradition and culinary creativity and skill was wonderful, as was the meal and the feeling of being full to the bursting, yet without teetering on the edge of a carbohydrate coma, left me itching to visit again.    Give polenta a chance - what this place does with it is magnificent.

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Spinach and polenta gnocchi with a gorgeous tomato sauce - the must-have on the menu.
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Cutie [polenta] pie.
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Not sure whether to eat, or cuddle...

6VWLClwlbeObn_XDp_v7Mw.text: The outside window always made me want to walk in. Polentaria specialize in polenta dishes (who knew) and it's good. I went there for lunch and ordered the polenta gnocci with truffle and it was delicious. I was a bit disappointed by the portions at start but it was actually the perfect quantity for a main (polenta is very filling).Nice service but I have to say a bit overpriced for what it is - £10 for 10 gnocchis.

yMz3rFkv1u818OB9QZsrjw.text: Twice in my life I have experienced rocks/dirt in the food served to me at a restaurant. Both times the server attempted to explain it away in a ludicrous fashion. This was the second time.I ordered a gnocchi made with mushrooms and polenta. They were quite mushy, which was fine because they were really quite smooth... Except for the dirt. Every bite had dirt in it. It's a pretty unmistakable crunch feeling in your mouth and it's not uncommon with mushrooms that haven't been properly cleaned. I didn't make a fuss because they'd been kind enough to seat me without a booking and told me I'd only have 35 minutes, so I knew it wouldn't be useful to ask to swap it out. And it was drowning in truffle oil. So, you know... truffle oil can kind of make anything edible.When asked how the food was, I told the server about the dirt in the gnocchi and she assured me it must have been chunks of mushroom. I mean... I've been eating food all my 40 years. I'm quite familiar with the difference between a chunk of mushroom and dirt. In addition to this, when I arrived a different server took my order and she had such contempt for me I felt bad for even visiting. And it's worth mentioning that the couple next to me complained that their dishes were both quite cold.I've been in UK for 10 days and every other dining experience has been a delight. This one stood out in the worst way.

hQi9GetjA6d4fA0qTflqbQ.text: Came here tonight and was very pleasantly surprised. The food far surpassed our expectations, the only real downside was the temperature - it was incredibly warm inside and we were all a bit uncomfortable.We ordered two sides as starters, the grilled polenta with red pesto and the bread with the aubergine caponata. Both were excellent.For mains, I got the duck ravioli which was very good but also very rich. It used ground duck which I'd never seen before, and had a slightly bland flavour in the duck itself, but all the ingredients combined to great flavour.Other dishes ordered were the bolognese, the ricotta and spinach balls, and the polenta gnocchi with salmon. Everyone was quite happy with their meals, though none of us were able to clean our plates - the dishes were surprisingly filling, especially after we'd had our starters.It's a small place and might be better suited for the summer as people were trying to navigate walking through with thicker coats without knocking over glasses on other tables - but other than that and the temperature, a place I would definitely recommend.

ZF1BcvN3Rd7EtVXQ-u9oYA.text: If you're going to call your restaurant 'La Polenteria', you'd better be able to cook decent polenta. And even if polenta is your thing, that's no excuse to neglect the rest of the dish. The polenta was bad, and everything else was bland. And I don't understand how a a tiny slate consisting of maybe a quarter of an avocado, some flaked salmon and polenta can cost £13. The side salad was literally just a chopped up iceberg lettuce (still wet), some tomatoes and a few slices of raw mushroom.On top of the mediocre food, the service was somewhat weird. I understand that the management may take a cut of the service charge (and I disagree with this practice and circumvent it using cash whenever I can - and feel the service warrants it), but that doesn't mean its okay to insist that we process the service charge as a separate card transaction because "it's better for us". Perhaps the staff would also be better off avoiding this place if that's the game they have to play.I really hope they were just having a bad night, but I won't be going back.

RiXHi61p7h3-ICjq48iUDg.text: Together with my friend I was the lucky winner of the Sagitter One competition during the Yelp Mad Scientist Soiree, which brought us for a dinner to La Polenteria.Being a huge fan of Italian cuisine but having  tried only supermarket polenta before and not being convinced I really had  liked it, I was really looking forward to having 'a proper one' to see if it'd change my mind.And I wasn't let down. We were welcomed with the typical laud & hearty Italian 'Buona Sera,' by Francesco, who to our surprise has a Polish girlfriend from a city next to ours and speaks beautiful Polish, which doesn't often happen among foreigners in London.    The place isn't big, quite buzzy but at the same time very homey. It seems that people who work there enjoy themselves and share the Italian hospitality at its best (Francesco hasn't stopped entertaining us for the whole evening, evening playing 80s disco-Italiano songs at our request).  I was really looking forward to trying their truffle special I'd spotted on Facebook before, but unfortunately, they didn't have it that night. We've started off with egg, black pepper, scamorza cheese, smoked salmon, lumpfish eggs and orange which was very good. To my surprise the polenta was creamy and very tasty. The other starter was a board of cheeses (cimbro salvia e rosmarino, monteveronese malga 24 months, gorgonzola and caprino cheese with truffle) which came with little pieces of grilled polenta, quince jelly and oils. I'm a cheese monster, so I've tried many interesting cheeses befor, but I must say the truffle cheese was one of the best I've ever tried! However, considering most of the mains cost on average 10 pounds, I found this starter a little bit pricey. For mains we both took creamy polenta and grilled tomino cheese with onion's marmalade (my friend went for the non-vegetarian option with pancetta). I've never tried that cheese before and I really enjoyed it especially with the onion marmalade. I couldn't finish it, though, as the starters were already quite generous. The menu changes regularly, and from me personally a big bonus for gluten free options.If you still not convinced about polenta, you can choose from regular pasta dishes like pappardelle, lasagna or gnocchi in numerous variations. You can also compose your own salad.The dessert list looked very tempting, but we were too full to try anything.After one glass of wine, I left La Polenteria in such high spirits that I felt as if I had had a few. We had great fun, we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom

xLVM2pDk3e95uHLV4LlDFQ.text: Tried polenta for the first time here and to be honest it's not my cup of tea. Bought a voucher on Amazon local for a set menu for two people for only £21. This includes a glass of wine each so reasonably good value. The problem was the choice of dishes on the menu were quite limited, and what read well was actually quite tasteless and bland. I only ate half of both starter and main course, but the glass of white wine was really nice. The staff were lovely and the waiter didn't charge us for a bottle of sparkling water even though it wasn't included in the voucher. If you know that you like polenta, this is a lovely friendly restaurant but I've simply discovered that I really, really don't like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Guess Polenta is an acquired taste.
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Looks better than it tasted.

S0PQIinXEEFMm6-GB1u5GA.text: I like it when new types of businesses open - innovation drives us forward and over the last 10 years, the food scene in London has really diversified and I would now put London up against any other foodie city on the planet. Yes, reallyLa Polenteria has just opened its doors and they're still running a 30% opening discount on their polenta main dishes. That and curiosity drew me in for lunch todayItaly has elevated some of their peasant food into restaurant food and polenta continues this trend. Their menu is built around polenta - crushed cornmeal. It appears with fruit in their breakfast menu, with a choice of meat, fish and vegetarian accompaniments as a main course and in desserts such as cupcakesThe staff were very friendly and we had a good natter about everything Italian from football to mama;s cookingI chose Tuscan sausages to go with my polenta. I was pleased to see that polenta still had pride of place on the plate - it was creamy and well seasoned, Very satisfying on a cold day like today. The Tuscan sausages came in a tomato based sauce with beans, I felt the sausages could have done with a little more pumch but still a most satisfying plateThe cupcakes looked inviting but I had other plans for dessert today. An interesting addition to London's dining scene

photos.caption: Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Desserts
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Pear juice
Photo of Leggero - London, United Kingdom. Polenta with Tuscan sausage

vZ1L_nZYIT1watxCF1eWPw.text: (reposted from my OpenTable review)I really wanted to like this place, but the food was not good at all.   The starter "Liver & Bacon Served with Mashed Potatoes and Grilled Polenta" was an unseasoned full-sized liver filet tossed on plain mash with four strips of bacon on top (note that this was recommended for one person.  It was - by weight - an entree by itself but luckily we split it).  Also, the Polenta tasted reheated, not grilled at all.The "Pork Belly Served with Creamy Polenta, Home Made Gravy and Grilled Vegetables" had a polenta that was sticky and solid.  The only creamy aspect was the gravy (which was decent).  The pork belly skin was not crispy and rather inedible and the vegetables were grilled/cooked to the point of almost being liquid. My wife had the Handmade "Teff Lemon Ravioloni," and the lemon curd was bland, but that was also all you could taste.  If there was any seafood in the ravioli, it went unnoticed in both quantity and flavor.As someone who cannot eat gluten, I've learned to make concessions, but this was not good in any sense other than portion size.  I love polenta and love its naturally gluten-free flavor, but this was incredibly poor and uninspired execution. I have to hope - given the other stellar reviews - that this was just their worst day since opening, because I have no idea how they could warrant the number of five-star rating they've received.I will end on a bright note: The focaccia was excellent.================I want to add that I don't usually write Yelp reviews.  I understand that people's livelihoods are dependent on these reviews, and that there can be issues from day-to-day, but this was just so bad all around that I had to write this.

GADlfgJVKY2ZjTT-NS1uIg.text: This is just your standard run of the mill polenta place.(Oh your neighborhood doesn't have 48 polenta places on every block?Well it should! Polenta is good!)Well, since not enough people eat polenta, this is a great place to get the word out on how great polenta is.Yeah - they have sandwiches and salads - but you know what you are here for.It comes with about 8 to 10 choices of toppings most of Mediterranean extraction and most good.The Sicilian Caponata (that's eggplant for them that don't know - like me coming in) is a wonderful italian dish that could easily stand on its own but serves well as a polenta topping.the Bacalhau (thats salt cod for them that don't know - I had to guess from the portuguese) is on the salty side - which may be a sign of not enough soaking before cooking.it is still pretty good.but the star of the show is the polenta - which if it wasn't so much work to cook, would be the kind of thing i would like to eat every day. i might not take british rail all the way in from reading just to eat at la polentaria - but if i worked anywhere in the neighborhood, this would be a regular choice for lunch.
